Review.Titre: Estimates are wildly inaccurate.
Review.Contenu: ***Avoid this company***Estimates are wildly inaccurate.The estimates are incredibly inaccurate. I paid for a year of service but soon realised that the estimations were way off. I could have accepted up to a 20% difference, but most of them were showing over 5 times the actual sales at the very least. The worst case was more than 100 times off.When I contacted customer service about the issue, they simply blamed Amazon, saying they were only displaying the sub-category data. It would have been much better if the software showed no data at all, rather than providing such wildly inaccurate figures.They have now updated me 4 months later saying they have "fixed" the issue. This company has cost me thousands with their issues and then had the cheek to offer me 2 months free as "compensation".

Customer service did not respond to the e-mails that I sent to them. Avoid at all cost, they are scammers.

I believe most people who try to follow the simplistic recommendations on their blog will lose money.

I immediately contacted Jungle scout and they said "you are currently on a Tiered Plan which means that the price of your subscription depends on the number of orders that your Amazon Seller account has processed in the past 30 days."  Tricky tricky.  You cant find anything about tiered pricing on their site.  Luckily they did refund some of the months but I am still out over $4,000 in charges they will not refund.  Good products but beware of their trickery.

Review.Titre: Want to find something that really sells? Don't use Jungle Scout.
Review.Contenu: If you really want to find a product to sell on Amazon, Jungle Scout is the last thing you use. Jungle Scout is the single reason why THOUSANDS of people lose a lot of money.Every Amazon guru out there teaches you to use Jungle Scout because they get a cut every time someone buys it. Now every single one of those thousands of people uses close to the same search metrics to narrow down a product.When you eventually launch your product, you have A LOT of competition because everyone was using the same tool (Jungle Scout), to search for a product to sell. Don't be one of those people.There are much better ways to get new product ideas. Stop chasing volume. Focus on margins and be unique. Build your own brand and expand it constantly.

Review.Titre: Fees are misleading
Review.Contenu: The good:  the tools are really good to help filter down to some product ideas. Customer service is friendly and generally responsive .  Site has a wealth of information.The Bad:  this is where I take it from 5 stars to 2.  My first attempt at selling on Amazon was mostly learned through JS.  The problem I have is that the fees are not accurately calculated.  After several weeks and countless hours of research and product development I placed my first order based on info from the product database. It appeared from JS that I could net about $6-8 per unit after sourcing and shipping to Amazon.  The problem is that JS mis calculated fees by $6 thus leaving me with a product that will make no money. I have checked dozens of other products against the FBA fee calculator and they are way off. Mostly by 15%. Some over 20%. The mistake I made was finding the amazon fee calculator after my order was placed. I trusted JS’s info. They have skirted the problem in several emails and never addressed it head on.  It’s a problem and the info is highly misleading. To this day, it’s still a problem.

Review.Titre: Very Disappointing Customer Service
Review.Contenu: I enjoyed the software...however my annual subscription plan was upgraded without my knowledge. The customer service team only tried to sign me on to various other plans instead of addressing the issue. After being forced to choose a new plan, I was charged additional fees on my account, on top of what they already charged me for my annual subscription and the mysterious upgrade charge, with no clear explanation as to how any new charges were calculated. After a week of back and forth on email with no option to speak to someone else or escalate my concerns, I was forced to cancel my subscription due to this, which was not my intention. If it were not for this customer service experience, I would've remained a paying Jungle Scout customer. Although received I some partial refunds, only after having to ask repeatedly for them, I had to accept some charges - however there was no transparency in this whole process, none of the refunded or un-refunded amounts were clearly explained to me. And now my chrome extension is inactive - although i purchased this product as a one time charge back in 2018.  It was not part of a subscription.I'm leaving this review for current users, this will be the expectation in your near future.

Review.Titre: Very slow customer service
A great help and useful tool but with room for improvement
Review.Contenu: A great help and useful tool, though for the price I feel it could provide a better user experience.Pros: Saves you a crap ton of time.  It aggregates all the data that you want (or most of it anyway) from an Amazon search page in just a few minutes versus the 15 or so minutes it would take you to do the same.Easy to use.  Very easy.Cons:While it is far faster than doing the work yourself, it really could be faster.  Opening the extension on a search page still takes it a few minutes to grab all the data and then usually another minute for the "opportunity" score to appear.  Not deceptive, but they make it appear to function far faster in their videosLogging in all the time.  I get they don't want people sharing the app, bu the fact is almost everyone uses multiple computers and browsers these days.  Most have a PC and a laptop or example.  Every time I move from one to the other, I have to relog in.  Further more, if I want several browser windows open for organization, it often makes me log out in one to log in on another.Not as configureable as I'd like.  For example, you can't set how many results to list.  In nearly every class given on product research, including Jungle Scout's own videos, it is suggested to look at the top 10 for certain metrics.  This extension handily gives you information like average sales volume, average cost, average rating, etc but you can't see the averages for the Top 10 because it always retrieves 60 some odd results.  I'd love to see an option to limit the results to just the first 10-15 items (or really user settable) to make it both run faster and make the averages more useful.Laggy UI.  The UI is not smooth and sometimes frustrating.  When you are trying for example to remove items, the "X" often doesn't even show up, you have to wav your mouse around to get it to come up.  Adding items with the "+" icon sometimes just does nothing, or takes several seconds.No bulk actions.  It would be nice to be able to have a column for selecting multiple items and then have bulk operations on the selected items like add all selected to tracker, or export data just for selected items.Overall a very nice and useful extension, but with lots of room for improvement especially given the cost.  If it was half the price I would be more forgiving of its shortcomings.

Review.Titre: Be very careful! Unclear pricing scheme, auto charges and no notifications.
Review.Contenu: When we "subscribed" to a monthly plan to test out the software, their prompts told us it was $49/month for the plan we wanted. We figured that was an OK price to test out the software for a few months to see if it was something we could make use of. So, we subscribed and didn't think about the pricing again (rarely using the software) until 4 months later when reviewing our credit card statement I see that we had that same day been shifted into a "Seller Level 5" tier and charged an additional $350! Then, we were charged $400 per month for the next 3 months. Our accountant thought I had legitimately decided to pay $400 for the software so never raised the issue to me. Apparently, after subscribing, JungleScout prompted us to sync our orders in order to utilize all the "features" of their software. We didn't really need these additional features, but figured we'd test them out since we were paying for the software anyhow. Of course, those prompts didn't warn us that if our orders were above certain thresholds, we would be charged WAY more than we'd signed up for.  After JungleScout imported our sales stats they upped our fee without the slightest warning or notification either on our account after signing in nor via email. To top it off, JungleScout never sent 1 email with an invoice. To me, this implies that they are making every effort to hide their charges from sellers in order to swindle sellers into overpaying. Have you ever had an online subscription that didn't email you every time they charged you, nonetheless when they shift you into a new pricing tier that costs 4x more?? Of course, had I received any sort of notification I would have immediately canceled, but they probably know that and that's why they don't bother notifying customers.My guess is that this deception is part of their tactics, in hopes that as sellers grow they can skim more from their customers and hope it gets through unnoticed, siphoning away your hard earned money.  Even if you are a small seller, I would be wary to start developing your business practices around software built on such questionable tactics. If you decide to give it a try, just be aware of the pricing scheme. My suggestion would be to look elsewhere, as there are other options out there with similar tools that are transparent with their pricing. To JungleScout's credit, they did end up refunding the extra that was charged for those 4 months without too much of a hassle, but I doubt they will change their method of charging/notifying customers.The software may be OK, but it's clearly backed by a company with questionable tactics that I would not be comfortable basing my business around. We tested another option at the same time and preferred their data and interface over that of Jungle Scout, at least for what we wanted out of the software.TLDR - Beware of their pricing scheme that is not immediately apparent and that charges/increases automatically. You will receive no notification of charges or increases. There are other options, take the time to test out what's out there.

Review.Titre: Being new to the world of e-commerce…
Review.Contenu: Being new to the world of e-commerce marketing, I found Jungle Scout very helpful and reliable in analyzing marketing data.  I really liked how keywords were so easily generated.  it gave me a good understanding of market trends, profits and my competition in the market.  For a beginner like me it is a God sent feature to have. Another good feature is the fact that it can pull your listing off the Amazon pages, be edited and placed back!

Review.Titre: Great site for training information and…
Review.Contenu: Great site for training information and product research.  Two ideas I would like to share:  1.  on many occasions when copying and pasting an ASIN, no suppliers is displayed.  Perhaps some additional info on where to find suppliers may be less difficult (for newbies).  2.  After completion of the training videos, I still found it a bit confusing on when and amount of bar codes to purchase, and how to use,; and, the process of actually setting up on the amazon site.  It may just be me missing something tho.  Great job JS, great product!

Review.Titre: I had trouble with my account
Review.Contenu: I had trouble with my account, a screen would come up saying to upgrade my account whenever I would do anything. It was my fault I went through an affiliate and didn't realize it was just for new customers. But they helpful people at jungle scout got me going again. The only problem is it couldn't find a phone number to talk to an actual person and the chat box is all automated.

Review.Titre: Jungle Scout is a good extension
Review.Contenu: Jungle Scout is a good extension, however I'm currently with a program that uses a different extension. In order for me to stay on track I need to learn how to use the extension my program is utilizing. We receive hands on to assure we learn how to properly use this extension. So nothing negative about Jungle Scout, just need to learn how to utilize these programs.

Review.Titre: Instructions to connect JS with AMZ
Review.Contenu: I asked for instructions to connect JS with my Amazon account.The first instructions I received from JS were not helpful.The links I had to follow did not appear on amazon's website.It looked as if JS didn't have the latest version of Amazon's website (????)Eventually, I managed to reconnect AMZ with JS, but I did so without following JS's instructions.The JS person who contacted me, answered me every time, in a very short time. So my score is high.

Review.Titre: Jungle Scout was easy to deal with
Review.Contenu: Jungle Scout was easy to deal with. I cancelled because I simply wanted someone to help me pick a product and put on amazon for sale.  the process was too daunting and I decided not to continue. I simply don't have time for courses and calls all day. If someone were to simply call and help me find and put product on amazon I would not have cancelled.

Review.Titre: Quick response of customer service.
Review.Contenu: Problem solved in minutes, excellent customer service.

Review.Titre: So far so good!
Review.Contenu: So far so good! Been using this software to make my life easier and that's exactly what it does! Lots of tutorials for beginners, real people to answer questions and lots of information.  If you are trying to decide which software to go with, viral launch etc I would choose this to start.  Some running issues when using a mobile device though so could do with this fixing but maybe that's me?

Review.Titre: It's amazing all the information you…
Review.Contenu: It's amazing all the information you can get to make important decisions about what products you can sell on Amazon. I think that JS can improve the branded products that appear in the search as an opportunity but if you check them on amazon, there are many others that offer the same product but with a different brand, or those products that may be copyrighted, such as baby yoda, that appears a lot.

Review.Titre: Excellent attention
Review.Contenu: Jungle Scout has an amazing customer service. I had a problem with the system since not all the tools in the platform  are available for Mexico, so I requested support to check this, and they were very fast in response, direct to the point, I didn't need to struggle long processes.

Review.Titre: Jungle Scout Review
Review.Contenu: Quick and responsive to issues experienced while using the extension.Issues will always pop up, this is the nature of things. How they are handled makes all the difference and the Jungle Scout representative (Regina) was most helpful. I would highly recommend them for their tools as well as their service.

Review.Titre: Loads to learn and do with this tool!
Review.Contenu: I have joined Jungle Scout two months ago and I am still learning how to use the tool, there's some much you can do with it that can be overwhelming at first, but there's also loads of guidance and instructional videos you can follow. So far, it has helped me understand the world of e-commerce in a way that I would not have done if it wasn't for what they offer.

Review.Titre: Nice application to find product ideas | weekend plan pricing
Review.Contenu: I bought the extension to find a product to sell on Amazon the extension and its working good, for some the products the extension not showing any data . I don’t know what is the issue. Overall nice tool.Suggestion from me is to keep prices as pay per use or weekend plan or something because i only use the application tool on weekends.

Review.Titre: Great contribution to my workflow
Review.Contenu: The tools are very important to have and they are there for helping us in this journey, I'm rating 4stars because on Amazon Mexico I'm having some issues retrieving all the data accurately... I don't know if it's the platform itself (Mexico) or the bad listings quality or simply it needs more work. I like it in general and has been a great contribution to my workflow. Thanks JS, hope to stay for long!

Review.Titre: Great Information and Materials to help Seller Succeed
Review.Contenu: The information provided by the software and the training materials are great and on point. Really helpful. You're doing an amazing job on that front. The software however is buggy. Buttons sometimes don't work and often when I open it on Chrome the format doesn't look right. I have to use Safari for the product database and then Chrome for The Plugin, but nothing that will prevent someone from using the product. Product experience is very important to me, otherwise, it'd be a 5 star from, no doubt.

Review.Titre: Two things that I would like to get easier
Review.Contenu: Don't know if it's just me but every time I enter Junglescout from my cellphone to my laptop I have to log in. I suppose it logged out automatically for security but it's kind of annoying.Another thing that bothers me is that if I want to add a new product to a product group I have to zoom out the Chrome screen in order to be able to scroll down to the desired product group (since i have more than ten). Thanks!

Review.Titre: Jungle Scout has valuable information…
Review.Contenu: Jungle Scout has valuable information for new and experienced sellers. I have learned so much.  The tips and weekly webinars are great educational tools.Support reaches out in a timely manner on resolving and answering questions. It would be nice to see the subject of the initial issue displayed in the email subject line instead of the ticket number. It is easier for end-users to navigate and decipher through the work order tickets that are in the Inbox.

Review.Titre: Promotion was on Facebook
Review.Contenu: Response time was great. I put 4 stars because there was actually a promotion I saw on Facebook but was not given that option or explanation why I wouldn't be eligible for it. The promotion didn't mention anything if that it is for new or existing members. Overall, I'm still satisfied with the service. Thank you!

Review.Titre: I am glad my issue was resolved and I…
Review.Contenu: I am glad my issue was resolved and I got a refund, but it was a little frustrating that I had to reach out again to cancel my subscription and get a refund. Also it seems that without posting in the facebook group I would have had to wait even longer for a response. I am not mad but it was a frustrating moment.

Review.Titre: Gives a lot of insight
Review.Contenu: Gives a lot of insight, and there's  also a lot of training content which is a god send for beginners. The price is reasonable compared to others. The only thing I would say is the program that's used to find the supplier of already selling products (to me) just seems to general random suppliers. Please correct me if I'm wrong though as I'm still fairly new at all this, but on the whole I'm pleased with the information that's given by Jungle Scout.

Review.Titre: JS has really been doing well giving…
Review.Contenu: JS has really been doing well giving people more insight on how to get a source product and factors to consider to be able to make your product on point. This has really helped me in building my own e-commerce. Thanks to you JS

Review.Titre: Overall the software is beneficial when…
Review.Contenu: Overall the software is beneficial when you're beginning to sell on Amazon. It provides great insight into the products' details - daily sales, monthly sales, rankings, amount of sellers, etc. Sometimes I find the software to have glitches and not work as it's supposed to, but overall I really like it.

Review.Titre: Great resource!
Review.Contenu: I found Jungle Scout to be a great resource, and their free guides - especially the Million Dollar Case Study - to be incredibly useful, however I would recommend not limiting yourself to the recommended search settings, otherwise you will be seeing the same results as everyone else who is searching and wind up launching the same products at the same time.

Review.Titre: in the product tracker
Review.Contenu: in the product tracker, I faced a technical problems to classify my ungrouped productroll down menu was not showing all the product titles I created I contacted the help center within 2 days we succeed to fix it hope that this feed back will encourage JS to improve the interface to avoid recurrence

Review.Titre: Jungle Scout is wonderful
Review.Contenu: Jungle Scout is wonderful. I've tried others, and none like you. My suggestion is to have the option of the Spanish version ... we are many Latinos using it and it will be very easy for us to be in our language.You should have promotions for those who have already bought a product and want to buy it again, like the app. By far .... the best !!!

Review.Titre: Just starting out with this app
Review.Contenu: Just starting out with this app. I think it could use more videos on how to use the product effectively - rather than having to search for YouTube video's from other people.------Much later - Many thanks to the team at Jungle Scout, I have looked at a number of the training videos in the app and they are well laid out and very informational. All falling into place now!

Review.Titre: Good customer support
Review.Contenu: Keyword Scout could not generate the CSV file. I contacted customer support and the issue was solved next day. Although I'm pretty satisfied with the response, the only reason I don't give them five stars is because I was focused and that issue distracted me and made me lose time.

Review.Titre: Decent product & service
Review.Contenu: If one purchases the lifetime chrome plugin (~$500) it becomes useless without the $197/yr subscription. That’s a bit schistery. Not to mention, that there is no notification of the annual charge also seems like the focus is on profit over customers. The lack of any form of communication aside from email also doesn’t sit too well (instant messaging is “in the works”). Despite these issues, I would still recommend the product and company. They will put forth every effort to make sure you are satisfied.

Review.Titre: Jungle Scout and the Extension had bugs…
Review.Contenu: Jungle Scout and the Extension had bugs and could not be fixed for a long time. For this I would give 3 stars. On the other hand, the support people tried very hard to fix the bugs and were generous with the compensation. Therefore I give 4 stars. I will continue using JS. Thanks Folks!

Review.Contenu: HI Guys Love your system but I still get confused with things ( as you do when your 70 LOL) finding suppliers is our problem with products that are not over run by sellers already on Amazon and not sure where to go to try to find those not exclusive but products that only have a few sellers.I know we will do fine once we get sorted out just trying to compensate for a lack of a decent pension and make a decent living Best Regards Frank KingstonThe Moni Tree LLC
